alert.note: Alert for Inland Berkeley (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 5:28PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EASTERN LAKE MARION... ...MARINERS SHOULD SEEK SAFE HARBOR... At 528 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 7 nm west of Eastern Lake Marion, or 16 nm south of Manning, moving east at 20 knots. HAZARD...strong winds 35 to 45 knots and excessive cloud to water lightning. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect briefly stronger winds and suddenly higher waves. Excessive lightning will strike the open lake waters. Lightning can endanger your life and damage your boat. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Boaters on the eastern portions of Lake Marion should seek safe harbor immediately. If caught on the open water, stay as low as possible and wear a personal flotation device. Remember, if you can hear thunder you are at risk for being struck by lightning.
